item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 22, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple pulls data protection tool after UK government security row (1012 points | 737 comments)
2. Paxlovid: You'd have expected more (39 points | 21 comments)
3. Richard Feynman's blackboard at the time of his death (1988) (235 points | 125 comments)
4. Google Titans Model Explained: The Future of Memory-Driven AI Architectures (89 points | 21 comments)
5. Why Ruby on Rails still matters (220 points | 169 comments)
6. The Ren'Py Visual Novel Engine (123 points | 42 comments)
7. Yocto, RockPi and SBOMs: Building modern embedded Linux images (92 points | 45 comments)
8. Show HN: Slime OS – An open-source app launcher for RP2040 based devices (76 points | 4 comments)
9. Math Academy, part 1: My eigenvector embarassment (26 points | 13 comments)
10. Surface-Stable Fractal Dither on Playdate (19 points | discuss)
11. Sparse Voxels Rasterization: Real-Time High-Fidelity Radiance Field Rendering (56 points | 13 comments)
12. Launch HN: Massdriver (YC W22) – Self-serve cloud infra without the red tape (54 points | 41 comments)
13. Reality has a surprising amount of detail (2017) (248 points | 129 comments)
14. Johnny.Decimal – A system to organise your life (310 points | 176 comments)
15. SVDQuant+NVFP4: 4× Smaller, 3× Faster FLUX with 16-bit Quality on Blackwell GPUs (15 points | 3 comments)
16. DeepDive in everything of Llama3: revealing detailed insights and implementation (120 points | 8 comments)
17. Waste-based perovskite solar cell achieves 21.39% energy efficiency (29 points | 12 comments)
18. Suckless.org: software that sucks less (215 points | 112 comments)
19. 20 years working on the same software product (273 points | 89 comments)
20. Docker limits unauthenticated pulls to 10/HR/IP from Docker Hub, from March 1 (366 points | 389 comments)
21. Every .gov Domain (298 points | 245 comments)
22. Can you lose your native tongue? (2024) (34 points | 47 comments)
23. Train Your Own O1 Preview Model Within $450 (384 points | 60 comments)
24. I found a backdoor into my bed (612 points | 287 comments)
25. Posh (YC W22) Is Hiring ( | hide)
26. General Reasoning: Free, open resource for building large reasoning models (61 points | 11 comments)
27. Some critical issues with the SWE-bench dataset (304 points | 105 comments)
28. Cot: The Rust web framework for lazy developers (74 points | 40 comments)
29. I shouldn't of made this. Another direnv alternative for no reason (8 points | 6 comments)
30. Ancient switch to soft food gave us overbite–the ability to pronounce 'f's,'v' (136 points | 94 comments)
